text: June Florence Foulds (13 June 1934 – November 2020) was a British track and field sprint runner. She was married to British Olympic fencer Raymond Paul. She appeared as a "castaway" on the BBC Radio programme Desert Island Discs on 17 November 1958. Foulds died at the age of 86. Foulds competed in the 100 m, 200 m and 4 × 100 metres relay at the 1952 and 1956 Olympics and won a bronze and a silver medal in the relay. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Olympic silver medalists for Great Britain Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Great Britain
title: June Foulds
